title: Evonik Jayhawk and Dixie collaborate on epoxy thermal curatives
text:
Evonik Jayhawk and Dixie collaborate on epoxy thermal curatives 8 September 2015 
Evonik Jayhawk Fine Chemicals has entered into a joint development agreement with US-based Dixie Chemicals to develop new epoxy thermal curatives. 
The new thermal curatives will incorporate capabilities of Evonik's Jayhawk dianhydride and Dixie's monoanhydride. 
Evonik marketing and business development director Borys Schafran said: "These new products will not only address ease-of-use, which customers have been asking for, but will also improve the properties of epoxy coatings, moulding compounds and composite materials. "These new products will improve the properties of epoxy coatings, moulding compounds and composite materials." 
"This is especially important in applications where sustained mechanical, thermal and di-electric properties in adverse conditions over longer periods of time is a must-have requirement." 
Dixie will market a range of new products from early 2016. 
Separately, Evonik Jayhawk Fine Chemicals and Nexam Chemical have partnered to supply their dianhydrides and NEXIMID crosslinkers to the polyimide sector. 
The partners will modify and enhance polyimide processing and help customers in product selection, pairing and optimal dosing for polyimide coatings, films, fibres, foams, and resins. 
Evonik Performance Materials segment manufactures polymer materials and intermediates for the agriculture, rubber and plastics industries. 
Last year, the division recorded revenues of €3.83bn, and has a workforce of around 4,400. 
Evonik business activities are spread across nutrition and care, resource efficiency, and performance materials. The company generated sales of around €12.9bn in 2014. Follow Us:
